summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Bureau of Prisons Senior Officer Specialist/Lieutenant regarding her duties and observations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 9, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died. She describes prison procedures, rounds, counts, and her limited interactions with Epstein that day.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who died at MCC on August 10, 2019. The interviewee saw him in the attorney conference area on August 9, 2019, with his attorneys.

persons.name: Todd
persons.context: Present for the interview at the United States Attorney's Office. Went over a standard proffer agreement with the interviewee.

persons.name: Natali
persons.context: Attorney for the BOP employee being interviewed. Advised that the interview was in lieu of a grand jury appearance and was voluntary.

connections.description: Natali is the attorney representing the BOP employee (EMPLOYEE 7) during the FBI interview.
AUSA Todd conducted the interview/proffer agreement with the BOP employee regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day Alive
events.description: The BOP employee recalls seeing Jeffrey Epstein in the attorney conference area around 9am with 3-4 attorneys. She also made rounds in the SHU around 10pm, noting regular operations.

events.title: Epstein's Alleged Prior Suicide Attempt
events.description: The interviewee states she only heard things in passing regarding Epstein's alleged suicide attempt in July 2019.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Employee
events.description: FBI and SDNY officials interview a BOP Senior Officer Specialist/Lieutenant about prison procedures and her observations on August 9, 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: The interviewee, a BOP Senior Officer Specialist/Lieutenant, saw Jeffrey Epstein in the attorney conference area at MCC around 9am on August 9, 2019, with 3-4 attorneys.
She visited the Special Housing Unit (SHU) around 10pm on August 9 and recalled regular activities were occurring.
She stated she was not aware of how Epstein's cellmates were selected and did not know the specific procedures for an inmate coming off suicide watch.
The interview was conducted under a proffer agreement and was in lieu of a grand jury appearance.
Count paperwork at MCC is kept in Control for 30 days and then shredded.
